message: Hi, I put together http://weddingify.com so that royal wedding fans can follow real-time tweets located around the royal wedding. I used Google Maps API, jQuery, Twitter Search API and Java. I would appreciate any feedback. Thanks in advance!
@chico that's neat! Can the tweets be clickable so that we can reply to them?

uhm...testing testing is this thing on?  nopt sure its working (at least nothing happening in IE) , basically just displays map of London, i tried zooming out but that didnt seem to do anything either.

If it was meant to move the map when working then you might want to have the view of the earth a little further out OR rotating like the twittervision guy had.

Sorry i dont have better feedback for you.

Lol. What is this IE of which you speak? Yeah the tweets don't show up in IE and neither does the side panel. Well the panel does but it's blank and under the map. Looks great in chrome and Firefox on windows and linux though. Good work chico!
tested with Firefox/Chrome/Safari, sorry haven't got the energy right now to fix it on IE
@minxymoggy thx for the feedback, you can now click on the 'pretty' date under each tweet and it will open up the tweet in another tab so you can reply or retweet it
What are you using java for? curious
thx @HeyChinasky on helping to fix it on IE
@italiano40 Java back-end is periodically looking for new tweets using the Twitter Search API, and is serving up the 50 most recent tweets as JSON http://weddingify.com/tweets
